Sentencas: Partial internal short circuit resulting from the Ce4+/Ce3+ redox reaction is currently one of the most critical issues that hinder the practical application of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) with doped ceria electrolytes.
Titulo: A new in situ strategy to eliminate partial internal short circuit in Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9-based solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this work, a new strategy utilizing a Sr diffusion induced in situ solid-state reaction to generate a blocking layer to prevent Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9 (SDC) from reduction is proposed for the first time.
Titulo: A new in situ strategy to eliminate partial internal short circuit in Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9-based solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: As a proof of concept, Ni-SrCe0.95Yb0.05O3-delta is deployed as a Sr source for the electron-blocking interlayer and was evaluated as an anode for SDC-based SOFCs.
Titulo: A new in situ strategy to eliminate partial internal short circuit in Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9-based solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A thin interlayer composed of SrCe1-x(Sm,Yb)(x)O3-delta and SDC is formed in situ during the sintering process of the half cell due to the interdiffusion of metal cations, and the interlayer thickness is highly dependent on the sintering temperature.
Titulo: A new in situ strategy to eliminate partial internal short circuit in Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9-based solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The high-resolution TEM results indicate that the SrCe1-x(Sm,Yb)(x)O3-delta perovskite phase is generated and coated on the SDC grains, forming an SDC@SrCe1-x(Sm,Yb)(x)O3-delta core-shell structure.
Titulo: A new in situ strategy to eliminate partial internal short circuit in Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9-based solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The SrCe1-x(Sm,Yb)(x)O3-delta phase effectively suppresses the Ce4+/Ce3+ redox reaction and hence eliminates electronic conduction through the electrolyte membrane.
Titulo: A new in situ strategy to eliminate partial internal short circuit in Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9-based solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Consequently, the OCVs of the fuel cell are significantly improved after incorporating the electron-blocking interlayer and increase with increasing the interlayer thickness.
Titulo: A new in situ strategy to eliminate partial internal short circuit in Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9-based solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The OCVs of the cell sintered at 1250 degrees C reach 0.962, 0.989, 1.017, and 1.039 V at 650, 600, 550, and 500 degrees C, respectively.
Titulo: A new in situ strategy to eliminate partial internal short circuit in Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9-based solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The present results demonstrate that Ni-SrCeO3-based composites are promising alternative anodes for CeO2-based SOFCs towards enhanced working efficiency at high operating voltages.
Titulo: A new in situ strategy to eliminate partial internal short circuit in Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9-based solid oxide fuel cells
